THE SATURDAY EVENING POST
A blue carpet is unrolled
for your departure and you
attal its a bald cycl
Notting fiver
flies the Atlantic!
Every day of the week
"THE PRESIDENT" or
"THE PRESIDENT SPECIAL"
is at your service to
LONDON or PARIS
... 3 flights a week
to ROME
NEW HORIZONS
Maeniave your meals alot
are prepared by Maxim s. the mos
celebrated restaurant in Paris
Here is truly the world's most luxurious air service ... pro-
vided for you by the World's Most Experienced Airline.
All flights are in giant double-decked "Strato" Clippers*.
• Aboard The President you savor a magnificent seven-course
continental dinner by Maxim's. It includes cocktails, vintage
French wine, choice of liqueurs. Lower-deck club lounge. Every
passenger receives a smart overnight bag ... and each lady
receives a lovely orchid and Lanvin's "Arpège."
• Aboard The President Special you enjoy all the advantages
of The President. In addition, there's a superb French cham-
pagne with dinner. The passenger list is limited, yet there are
extra attendants. Exclusive Sleeperette* service gives twice as
much leg room... and lets you sleep in bed-length comfort.
No extra fare on The President; ten-dollar surcharge on
The President Special. Foam-soft berths available on all flights
at $25. Call your Travel Agent or Pan American.
Get the facts before you go!
Send for New Horizons, big 196-page illustrated book that will help
you get the most from your trip abroad. 13.501 up-to-date facts
about 900 places on 6 continents ... tells what to see, do, wear and
take nome. rew more useful books on how to travel have ever been
published!" —Lowell Thomas.
A take-along must for evervone
travelling abroad." —James A. Michener, author of "Tales of the
South Pacific." Only a dollar. Send for yours today!
OVER 75,000 COPIES SOLD!
lend today.
PAN AMERICAN, Dept. NH-2,
Box 11. New York 17AN.Y
Enclosed is one dollar. Please send my copy of "New Horizons."
Only overnight to London! You arrive relaxed and refreshed, ready to see the

properties.sfomuseum:description: Advertisement from March 15, 1952 issue of Saturday Evening Post promoting Pan American World Airways, titled “Nothing finer flies the Atlantic!” with color illustration depicting back view of couple standing on sidewalk facing Big Ben clock tower, London.
properties.sfomuseum:subject: Pan Am promotional advertisement
